meanings.definition: The act of causing things to happen at the same time or speed.
meanings.sent1: The synchronizations of the dancers' movements impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The music and lights were in perfect synchronizations during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The synchronizations of the traffic lights made the intersection look like a dance floor.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to achieve perfect synchronizations in her routines was like a well-choreographed symphony.
meanings.sent5: The synchronizations of the clocks in the house made it feel like time was dancing around us.

meanings.definition: The coordination of events to operate simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The synchronizations of the team members ensured the project's success.
meanings.sent2: The synchronizations of the gears in the machine were crucial for its efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The synchronizations of the pets' feeding schedules kept the house peaceful.
meanings.sent4: The synchronizations of the planets moving in harmony fascinated the astronomers.
meanings.sent5: The synchronizations of the traffic signals prevented chaos on the roads.

meanings.definition: The process of aligning actions or processes in time.
meanings.sent1: The synchronizations of the schedules made the meeting run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The synchronizations of the software updates improved the system's performance.
meanings.sent3: The synchronizations of the students' lunch breaks created a funny domino effect.
meanings.sent4: The synchronizations of the heartbeats of the lovers felt like a shared rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The synchronizations of the birds' flight patterns painted a beautiful picture in the sky.
